dt: {bc}a picture (such as an engraving or photograph) that shades off gradually into the surrounding paper
{bc}the pictorial part of a postage stamp design as distinguished from the frame and lettering
{bc}a brief incident or scene (as in a play or movie)
{bc}a running ornament (as of vine leaves, tendrils, and grapes) put on or just before a title page or at the beginning or end of a chapter
{bc}a small decorative design or picture so placed

et: French, from Middle French {it}vignete{/it}, from diminutive of {it}vigne{/it} vine {ma}{mat|vine:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a picture (such as an engraving or photograph) that shades off gradually into the surrounding paper

dt: {bc}to finish (something, such as a photograph) like a vignette
